basics.name: Onyekachi Osisiogu
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: Data scientist and computational mathematician with a Ph.D. in Computational Mathematics.

work.name: Illinois Institute of Technology
work.summary: At Illinois Institute of Technology, I served as a Senior Research Associate and Visiting Assistant Professor, focusing on algorithm efficiency and Information-Based Complexity. I collaborated on innovative projects and delivered engaging lectures in undergraduate calculus courses.

work.name: Johann Radon Institute for Computational and Applied Mathematics (RICAM)
work.summary: At RICAM, I developed efficient quasi-Monte Carlo algorithms, resulting in four journal publications. I optimized data exchange within the team, boosting research productivity.

volunteer.summary: As an AI/Data Science Trainer, I designed a comprehensive curriculum for data science and AI tracks, ensuring alignment with industry best practices. I created hands-on learning materials, including case studies and coding exercises.
highlights: Developed a cutting-edge curriculum for data science and AI
Created hands-on learning materials and real-world datasets
Ensured alignment with industry best practices and emerging trends

education.institution: African University of Science and Technology

awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to support advanced studies in mathematics and its applications.

awards.title: African University of Science and Technology Scholarship Award
awards.awarder: African University of Science and Technology (AUST)
awards.summary: Merit-based scholarship for exceptional academic performance in mathematics and computer science.
